SUMMARY: Campaigns are using social media influencers as a way to reach young and diverse voters, a novel and mostly unregulated strategy. Some are even spreading the message through dating apps.

TITLE: Why Does Twitter Verify Some Accounts?
SUMMARY: Elon Musk, who recently closed a deal to acquire the social media company, could soon charge a monthly fee for the blue verification badge that indicates a Twitter account is authentic.

TITLE: What Fed Rate Increases Mean for Mortgages, Credit Cards and More
SUMMARY: Savers will benefit and borrowers can expect to pay more on credit cards, student loans and other forms of debt.

TITLE: CVS and Walgreens Near $10 Billion Deal to Settle Opioid Cases
SUMMARY: The dual agreements would resolve thousands of lawsuits over the retailers’ role in the addiction crisis. But a large majority of state, local and tribal governments must sign on.

TITLE: Personal Tech Has Changed. So Must Our Coverage of It.
SUMMARY: Our tech problems have become more complex, so we are rebooting the Tech Fix column to focus on the societal implications of the tech we use.

TITLE: Worries Grow That TikTok Is New Home for Manipulated Video and Photos
SUMMARY: Misleading edits, fake news stories and deepfake images of politicians are starting to warp reality on the popular video platform.

TITLE: Workers Expect Fast Inflation Next Year. Could That Make It a Reality?
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve chair is eyeing near-term inflation expectations, which might shape wages — and help keep prices rising rapidly.

TITLE: Elon Musk Begins Layoffs at Twitter As Some Employees File Lawsuit
SUMMARY: The social media company’s 7,500 employees have been bracing for job cuts since Mr. Musk took it over last week.

TITLE: U.S. Job Growth Remains Strong
SUMMARY: The labor market remained robust in October, in the final glimpse at the state of the economy before the midterm elections. Although the unemployment rate rose, Americans are still seeing rapid wage gains.

TITLE: Elon Musk, Under Financial Pressure, Pushes to Make Money From Twitter
SUMMARY: The billionaire and his advisers have discussed adding paid direct messages, fees to watch videos and other features to the service.

TITLE: Amazon, Lyft and Other Tech Companies Announce Job Cuts and Hiring Freezes
SUMMARY: Amazon said it was pausing corporate hiring, while Lyft and Stripe said they were cutting jobs.

TITLE: Amid Forecasts of Recession, Bank of England Raises Interest Rates
SUMMARY: With inflation above 10 percent, the central bank ramped up its fight against price increases even as it predicted a “prolonged” recession.

TITLE: Expect Higher Health Insurance Premiums, but Not a Lot Higher
SUMMARY: Benefit costs may go up as much as 6 percent. Wary of driving workers away, many employers may not pass on the full increases, analysts say.

TITLE: Forecasting the Future of Election Prediction Markets
SUMMARY: After flying under the radar as academic experiments, the markets are facing close regulatory scrutiny. But they are worth preserving, our columnist says.

TITLE: Twitter Begins Laying Off Employees
SUMMARY: Employees of the social network will learn via email if they are out of a job — or if they will continue to work for Elon Musk.

TITLE: In Bid to Show It Is Open, Hong Kong Bends Covid Rules … for Some
SUMMARY: Three splashy events this week were meant to prove that the former British colony was still “Asia’s World City.” But Covid exemptions were provided for visitors from overseas, especially the wealthy ones.

TITLE: The Vegan Butchers Carving Your Thanksgiving Turkey
SUMMARY: Price of turkey got you down? How about roast beef, meatloaf, or brats. Thanks to these vegan butchers, you can have any cut of “meat” you want at Thanksgiving this year.

TITLE: Five Ways Sanctions Are Hitting Russia
SUMMARY: Russia’s economy and residents have taken a battering, but the government continues to reap big revenues from energy sales. A partial European embargo on oil takes effect in December.

TITLE: Twitter Employees on Life Under Elon Musk
SUMMARY: A radical shake-up is underway at the social media company.

TITLE: Battle Over Deep-Sea Mining Takes on New Urgency as Trial Run Winds Down
SUMMARY: A Canadian company is testing mining equipment in the Pacific Ocean in its quest for metals needed for electric vehicles. Environmentalists oppose the mining, which could begin in 2024.

TITLE: CNBC Cancels Shepard Smith’s Show in Move Away From General News
SUMMARY: Mr. Smith joined CNBC in 2020 after leaving his longtime home on Fox News, where he was a reliably nonpartisan presence.

TITLE: UK Takes Sides Over Bounty Chocolate
SUMMARY: Bounty, a chocolate-coconut concoction similar to Mounds, will be left out of some Celebrations holiday assortments this year, stirring a national debate.

TITLE: Clean Energy Tax Break Draws Scrutiny of Natural Gas Plan in New Mexico
SUMMARY: A defunct New Mexico coal plant would be revamped with the help of subsidies authorized by the new climate legislation, but a plan to rely on natural gas converted into hydrogen has generated criticism.

TITLE: White House Deletes Tweet Crediting Biden With Social Security Increase
SUMMARY: The automatic cost of living increase that Social Security beneficiaries are receiving is a result of soaring inflation, not a policy achievement enacted by President Biden.

TITLE: What Is Twitter Verification? A History.
SUMMARY: Elon Musk, who recently closed a deal to acquire the social media company, could soon charge a monthly fee for the blue verification badge that indicates a Twitter account is authentic.

TITLE: Confusion and Frustration Reign as Elon Musk Cuts Half of Twitter’s Staff
SUMMARY: The layoffs hit across many divisions, including the engineering and machine learning units, the teams that manage content moderation, and the sales and advertising departments.

TITLE: How an LAPD Officer Helped Les Moonves Fight an Assault Complaint
SUMMARY: A captain in the department, who had moonlighted as a security guard for CBS, disclosed to the network information about a confidential complaint made in 2017 against the C.E.O.

TITLE: Fed Up With Political Text Messages? Read On.
SUMMARY: In this polarized climate, hundreds of Americans told us they agree on one thing: Campaigns must stop spamming voters’ phones with unwanted political texts.

TITLE: YouTube May Have Misinformation Blind Spots, Researchers Say
SUMMARY: The video platform said it had limited the spread of misinformation ahead of Election Day, but new research showed that false narratives continued to slip through.

TITLE: Berkshire Hathaway Reports Third-Quarter Loss
SUMMARY: The company’s huge investment portfolio lost money, while its insurance arm felt the effects of Hurricane Ian and inflation-driven rises in property and damage claims.

TITLE: Twitter’s Advertisers Pull Back as Layoffs Sweep Through Company
SUMMARY: Elon Musk, Twitter’s new owner, acknowledged that ad spending on the platform had slumped. He blamed the drop on pressure from activists.

TITLE: On Social Media, Hunting for Voter Fraud Becomes a Game
SUMMARY: Players who post about irregularities are awarded points or titles, leading participants to question the legitimacy of elections.

TITLE: What Will the Midterms Mean for Big Business?
SUMMARY: The G.O.P. and corporate America, longtime allies, are showing signs of a breakup — which recent polls suggest will likely play out with a Republican House.

TITLE: Medicare Advantage or Just Medicare?
SUMMARY: It’s annual enrollment season once again. Here’s a look at the pros and cons of the two approaches to health insurance.

TITLE: Fed Frets About Shadow Banks and Eyes Treasury Liquidity in New Report
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve is watching the government bond market and investment funds as rate increases ricochet through finance.

TITLE: GOP Lawmakers Question Amtrak Over Six-Figure Bonuses
SUMMARY: Two Republicans on the House Transportation Committee asked the rail service to explain how it awards bonuses after top executives received payouts of more than $200,000 each last year.

TITLE: Biden Spins His Economic Record Ahead of Elections
SUMMARY: The president’s recent comments on Social Security, the deficit and economic growth claim credit where it is not always due.

TITLE: Germany’s Leader Seeks Accord With China on Covid Vaccines
SUMMARY: Chancellor Olaf Scholz said during a visit to Beijing that China and the European Union were working toward approval of each other’s pandemic vaccines.

TITLE: James Giffen, Who Was Embroiled in ‘Kazakhgate,’ Dies at 81
SUMMARY: The government charged him with funneling $78 million in bribes to Kazakhstan, but dropped the case after a judge decided he had acted with C.I.A. approval.

TITLE: U.S. Added 261,000 Jobs in Strong Showing
SUMMARY: Job growth is slowing but remains stronger than comfortable for the Federal Reserve, which is trying to tame high inflation.

TITLE: Twitter Begins Offering $7.99-a-Month Verification Subscriptions
SUMMARY: The new system for assigning check marks to users’ profiles is among a raft of changes the company has been discussing since Elon Musk’s takeover.

TITLE: The Week in Business: The Fed Stays Its Course
SUMMARY: Job growth slowed last month, but remained strong. Elon Musk cleaned house. And the economy will be a big issue in the midterms.

TITLE: British Soccer, Brought to You by American Crypto Optimism
SUMMARY: A group of American cryptocurrency investors is trying to turn an obscure English soccer club into “the internet’s team,” with a global following of crypto enthusiasts.

TITLE: Big Tobacco Heralds a Healthier World While Fighting Its Arrival
SUMMARY: The industry continues to back smoking protections, like this November’s ballot initiative in California that would overturn a law banning tobacco flavors.

TITLE: How Molly Jong-Fast Tweeted Her Way to Liberal Media Stardom
SUMMARY: She wasn’t a political expert. But her Trump-era angst found a following among Democrats — and even the White House is interested.

TITLE: Russia Reactivates Its Trolls and Bots Ahead of Tuesday’s Midterms
SUMMARY: Researchers have identified a series of Russian information operations to influence American elections and, perhaps, erode support for Ukraine.

TITLE: Macy’s Plans to Invest Millions to Fund Minority-Owned Businesses
SUMMARY: The department store chain is investing $30 million over five years to support entrepreneurs from underrepresented groups in the retail industry.
